Registration fixes
Revert back to Pew 2017 collection for default searches
notes.details: The Pew 2018 data has a lot of sources that cover entertainment and sports, and omits a lot of major news sources. For now we are reverting default searches back to the Pew 2017 data, while we investigate more.

notes.note: MediaPicker metadata checkboxes fixed
Login bug fixed
Remove system-level maintenance warning for week of Oct 7

Custom searches included with csvs. Non-logged-in users can run queries again.
Media Picker now enables you to create custom search collections
notes.details: Now you can search and save a set of custom searches containing a media keyword and a set of metadata tags. For example, search for sources with keyword 'mainstream' published in the US or Canada and in Massachusetts.' See our blog post for more information.

notes.note: More specific boolean query help under Enter Search Terms
Downloading topic story lists works again, with new options
notes.details: Now you can specify the size of the download, the sort order, and anny optional metadata you want to add.  The basic download with nothing is faster now too.

notes.note: Web app version numbers fixed

Inclusive start and end dates
notes.details: Across queries, we include the entire day's worth of stories encompassing 12 AM on the start date through 11:59:59 PM on the end date

notes.note: See subtopic information in version list
Better error feedback in create topic, including duplicate topic name

notes.note: See top images for Topic stories
notes.details: We now parse images out of a story you look at in Topic Mapper and show you the top image, with links to all of them (using the Newspaper3k library)

notes.note: Viewing historical collection attention works again

Better version indications & admin management shortcuts

notes.details: When you add a new query, the tabs up and the date shows up.

notes.note: Sources & collections on an Explorer search are clickable again
Topics now have different Versions
notes.details: See our blog post for details, there are many workflow changes related to creating and changing topics.

notes.note: Animated Word Space over time chart for a Topic works again
Quickly download the top stories within your Topic
See basic Reddit stats for stories within your Topic
notes.details: Including total submissions, submissions by subreddit, and submission counts for the quick top stories download

notes.note: Better URL support for explorer queries
notes.details: If you search against 'all media' now you can reload your query correctly from the URL.

notes.note: Download personal data
notes.details: You can now download all the data we have associated with your account directly from your profile page.

notes.note: Explorer saved searches work better
notes.details: Fixed a few bugs related to saving and loading searches in Explorer.

notes.note: Better explorer attention charts for sources with little data
notes.details: If you queried these before the dates might look weird if we had missing days; now we fill in the zeros.

notes.note: Exploreer Attention chart downloads work again
notes.details: The combined download wasn't working before, now it does.

notes.note: Query attention on Reddit
notes.details: Now in Explorer, if you pick the 'Reddit News Subs' source, you'll get attention data from Reddit (via PushShift.io)

notes.note: Explorer language tag refreshes when you run a new search
Sources manager now shows full history of story volume for collections & sources
Manage topics by version
notes.details: A major change to how you manage topics. Make new versions and track their status better.

notes.note: Show media-level tweet counts for Topics
Prototype support for querying Reddis News Subs
notes.details: Select the 'Reddit News Subs' source as your only one and the Attention tab results work.

notes.note: Users can now upload a spreadsheet of sources
notes.details: Spreadsheet uploaded enables collection curators to upload new sources into a collection or update ones in place.

notes.note: You can change your profile or delete your account
notes.details: We've also made a number of other changed to let you control your data better (thanks GDPR!). You can request a download of all your data, we respect the browser do-not-track setting, and we have a privacy policy.

notes.note: The detailed word cloud for Topics correctly respects your subtopic now
You can try out some API methods within our web app
notes.details: Click the user icon in the top right and pick 'API Console'

Warn people that we are switching to story-based searches.

Use the same word-count, and tag-count, sample sizes everywhere.

Link to list of the 600 themes we code for.

Speedup on showing languaeg results in Explorer.

Downloading topic story lists works again, and includes more data.
Better explanatory text next to visualizations in Explorer.

Story list download CSV now includes the themes detected.
New Source Manager & Topic Mapper homepage sections try to explain what they do better.
Better list of Newd collections.
notes.details: The list of Newd collections that see on the Source Manager homepage, and when picking media, was getting a bit stale.  We've updated that list to include more recent collections, and to help you get a sense of what is available for you to use in Media Cloud.

notes.note: Now Source Manager menu item to see all of our geographic collections.
Trying to add media to an Explorer query no longer resets the keywords.
Demo Explorer searches default to the past month now (instead of the past two weeks).
The source page in Source Manager now shows story counts over the last year.
notes.details: This is a better way to understand if a source is current or not.

notes.note: You can the sources in a collection again.
Collections now show public/private status correctly.
Better feedback about min/max sizes while creating topics.
Redid the source and collection homepages.
Support multiple quoted phrases in searches.
Better feedback when a topic you create is in the queue to run.
notes.details: This is not an error; you're just in line behind some other topics to run.  The note at the top tells you details about that.

notes.note: Update sample searches and example images.
Sped up source searching.
Fixeded default collection names on new Explorer queries.
Add option to view topic in Explorer to Topic control bar.
List geographic collections by country.
notes.details: Visit the Source Manager, then click the menu and select the 'Browse Geographic Collections' menu option.

notes.note: Speed up uploading a CSV of sources to a collection.
Link from source/collection page to Explorer, not Dashboard.
Automatically add http:// to source urls when uploaded in CSV.
Add stories per week to source detail page.
notes.details: This is really helpful if you are trying to find the most useful sources in our system.

notes.note: Remove misleading source health indications.
notes.details: The health measurement was based on some math about average stories per week that didn't work well.  Until we come up with a better solution we have removed that for now, so you're not told a source is 'unhealthy' when in fact it is working quite well.

notes.note: Media stories/inlinks/outlinks are downloadable again.
Allow you to copy keywords/date/media to all queries.
Return more results while searching for sources.
Faster langauge results when comparing multiple queries.
Better cursor when clicking a day on the attention over time chart.
Force short query names so the UI doesn't wrap weirdly.
Consistent text when renaming queries.
Better summaries on the little query tabs about sources/collections.
When you add a new query it copies the date from the last one.
Lets you edit query names after adding new queries.
Users can save new collections again.
Click on a point on the attention chart to see more details.
notes.details: This replicates a New we used to have on the Dashboard tool.  Click a data point on an Explorer attention chart and you'll see a sample of stories and a word cloud for just that time period.  This can help you identify what happened on a specific day.

notes.note: Comparative word cloud now reloads after new search is run.
Theme charts are now normalized so they aren't misleading.
notes.details: Sometimes the bubbles were really big, even though the number of stories with a certain theme were quite small.  We're now showing these as a ratio on top of a grey circle that represents the total number of stories, so you won't be misled by a big bubble only showing a small quantity.  This also helps compare theme results across different Explorer searches.

notes.note: Theme downloads now work for multiple queries.
New release notes menu and webpage to show recent changes.
Created a data-dictionary to document the collections CSV file format.
You can now search in all Media Cloud sources, even though this is a bad idea.
notes.details: Our collection of media sources is closely aligned with topics we have researched before, and doesn't represent a balanced list of media sources that represent the media ecosystem online. For instance, because we have done deep research on gender and reproductive rights, we have an over-representation of blogs and media outlets that cover those issues. The same is true for public health and international development. You should try to avoid searching all sources. Click 'Add Media' and pick some specific sources, or country-based collections to localize your search and get more representative results.

notes.note: Maps and entity lists now work for larger topics.
Fixed reloading explorer results pages.
Save search button now works in Firefox.
Better handling of unicode file names.
Reduce jumpiness of source search autocomplete.
Listing geographic collections and metadata is much faster.
Fixeded link to Sources app on the Tools page.
Download files without popups.
Show top themes results.
notes.details: These themes can help you identify the types of narratives the media is telling about your query. This is based on a transfer-learning model we built with the Google News word2vec model and the New York Times annotated corpus.

notes.note: Show more results on advanced search.
Better feedback when creating topics.
Correctly handle searches using "quoted phrases".
Use more consistent names for downloaded files.
Show more inlinks and outlinks on story details page.
Fixed bug that wouldn't let you edit dates sometimes.
More columns in story list CSV download.
Show better high level error messages.
Password reset works again.
Better signup errors.
Work on cache errors some folks are seeing.
Work on cache errors some folks are seeing.
Better nav-bar links between the tools.
Single sign on! Once you log in, you're logged into all the tools.
New homepages for all the tools.
notes.details: We did some user testing and have a new approach to the homepages. Hopefully this design clears up what each tool is for.

notes.note: Create subtopics by media type.
notes.details: You can now automatically divide up a topic based on the type of each media the stories are published by. Use this to compare print vs. online coverage, for instance. We have this information for lots of sources (from abyznewslinks.com), but definitely not all sources.

notes.note: Use the new media picker when creating topics.
Link to let you query the a topic in the Dashboard.
notes.details: Find this new link on the control bar on your topic's summary page.

notes.note: Support empty searches.
notes.details: These automatically turn into a "wildcard" search - ie. a search for "*".

notes.note: Show tweet counts on story tables (if twitter data available)
notes.deatils: For topics that been augmented by discovering links shared in related tweets, you can now see that twitter count on any story lists.
